item.title: The Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau extends a warm welcome to Muslim travelers
item.description: Source: Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau The Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau (YCVB) reports that its specialized Muslim Tourist Information microsite, part of the official Yokohama Visitors’ Guide website, is gaining traction with Muslims in Southeast Asia. Launched in December 2013, the Muslim Tourist Information website highlights tourist attractions, dining, halal shops, and mosques, all recommended by Yokohama’s Muslim residents. A survey of Southeast Asian Muslims revealed that over 90% found the information on restaurants, mosques, and recommended itineraries helpful.

item.title: Tourists are disappointed with shopping in Singapore, while locals are loyal to their telecommunications companies
item.description: A study by the Institute of Service Excellence (ISES) at Singapore Management University reveals a drop in customer satisfaction within Singapore’s retail and info-communications sectors. The 2014 Q1 Customer Satisfaction Index of Singapore (CSISG) indicates a 2.5 point (3.5%) decrease to 69.6 points for retail and a 0.9 point (1.3%) decrease to 66.8 points for info-communications, both compared to the previous year.
